attributes.action: FFP rules in English football are anti competitive and should be scrapped
attributes.additional_details: I would like parliament to advise the FA that it’s ‘fair play’ rules are nothing of the sort and that it must allow competition to thrive.
attributes.background: I would like parliament to look into the protectionist nature of FFP and debate wether this is anti competitive. I believe it is and therefore reduces competition in on of our most respected worldwide exports.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. Decisions about the Financial Fair Play Regulations are a matter for UEFA, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The Government has announced plans to create a new independent regulator for men's professional football, which will have powers in relation to the financial sustainability of football clubs. You can find out more about these plans here: https://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/CBP-9255/CBP-9255.pdf
